description: Dive into "Capturing Ahmedabad: A Photographic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Ahmedabad: A Photographic Journey

places.generalDescription: Law Garden is a popular public garden and market located near the Law College in Ahmedabad. The garden is surrounded by lush greenery and features a bustling evening market that extends till midnight. Visitors can explore stalls selling saris, embroidered textiles, local crafts, and other glittering wares from the Saurashtra and Kutch regions. The market is known for its premium quality ethnic Gujarati handicraft goods, making it a popular shopping destination for both locals and tourists.

sources.snippet: The best pre-wedding photographer in Ahmedabad includes a lot of fun at Ahmedabad's Law Garden, a beautifully kept green haven. It gives a happy and romantic mood because of the sculptures, vivid flowers, and beautiful lawns that are present. Couples can stroll through the vibrant flowers and discover picturesque spots to document their love story.
sources.shortName: Best 10 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad - VsnapU

sources.snippet: Situated at the heart of the city, law garden is a hangout spot for the people in all the ages. Little kids as well as the children enjoying horse rides, aunties enjoying the spicy Pani poori, uncles involved in the discussions and old people trying to keep themselves fit by the help of laughter clubs.
sources.shortName: Best places in Ahmedabad for street photography

places.name: Law Garden

reviews.text: Every Sunday morning, there are fun activities held outside the gate on Happy Street. Afterward, I visit the garden and spend some time by the lake, surrounded by trees. It's a truly beautiful experience.

üõçÔ∏è Shopping Galore: Best spot for ethnic wear, mirror-work blouses, bangles & handicrafts - pure desi vibes! Heaven for ladies. You'll find bright Gujarati bandhej sarees, embroidered chaniya-cholis and mirror-work blouses, plus a heap of colourful bangles, jewellery and accessories. Stalls also sell embroidered wall-hangings, silverware from Kutch, and cute home-decor knickknacks ‚Äì so you end up with bags full of goodies

üéâ Lively Feel: Market comes alive in the evening with lights, music & festive crowd.

üë• Full Local Vibe: Always buzzing with people - perfect for friends & family outings.

üí∏ Budget-Friendly: Great for bargaining - don't forget to haggle!

üÖøÔ∏è Parking: Paid hourly, a bit tricky to find during peak hours.

üç¢ Food: Street food is popular but not hygienic - better skip or be cautious.

‚≠ê Overall: Must-visit for shopping lovers in Ahmedabad!

places.generalDescription: Sabarmati Ashram, also known as Gandhi Ashram or Satyagraha Ashram, is a significant site of Hindu spirituality located in the Sabarmati suburb of Ahmedabad, Gujarat. It served as the residence for Mahatma Gandhi and his wife Kasturba Gandhi. The ashram is renowned for being the starting point of Gandhi's famous Dandi March.

sources.snippet: The Gandhi Ashram, located on the banks of the Sabarmati, is a must-visit when on the Gandhi trail. Home to Gandhi from 1917 to 1930, Sabarmati Ashram was one of the key places from where the struggle for Indian Independence started. He launched the Dandi March to protest against the British Salt Law from here on March 12, 1930.
sources.shortName: 22 places to visit in Ahmedabad that are not tourist traps

sources.snippet: Located at the banks of the Sabarmati River, the Ashram was established by the very hands of Mahatama Gandhi who resided here for 12 years. Sabarmati Ashram was known to be the focal point of the non-violent movement against freedom and also served as the base for the famous Salt Satyagrah. According to the ancient Hindu texts, the ashram is said to be located on the ancient site where sage Dadhich sacrificed his ribcage to make weapons for the Gods.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: 3 km from city center 4 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Once the residence of Mahatma Gandhi and his wife Kasturba, this undoubtedly is the biggest tourist attraction situated in the suburb of Ahmedabad, Gujarat. Located on the tranquil and serene stretch of Sabarmati River it was also referred to as the 'Satyagraha Ashram' as Gandhi began the famous 'Dandi March' from here.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Sabarmati Ashram | Among the Best Tourist Places in Ahmedabad. The very first name that pops into the mind at the mention of Ahmedabad is that of Mahatma Gandhi and Sabarmati Ashram. Once home to Bapu and being the centre of operations for the Indian freedom struggle, it is located on the banks of river Sabarmati.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Your Gujarat Sightseeing Tour would be more interesting and memorable if you visit Sabarmati Ashram. It is a worldwide popular tourist attraction in Ahmedabad. Dubbed as the second home of Mahatma Gandhi, Sabarmati Ashram is a Spartan colony of tiled houses in Ahmedabad.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

places.name: Sabarmati Ashram

reviews.text:
A visit to Sabarmati Ashram is not just a journey through space, but through time and ideals. Nestled quietly along the banks of the serene Sabarmati River in Ahmedabad, this ashram-once home to Mahatma Gandhi from 1917 to 1930-is a living testimony to India's freedom struggle.

Though Ahmedabad has grown into a bustling city, the path to the ashram still holds a certain calm. Passing through well-developed riverfront roads adorned with parks and gardens, we reached the 'Magan Gandhi Gate'-a quieter entrance. Despite being a weekend, the ashram remained calm and uncrowded, amplifying its aura of peace and simplicity.

Inside, the shady trees, humble buildings, and displays of Gandhi's life and tools, especially inside Magan Nivas and Hriday Kunj, evoke deep reflection. Each corner, from prayer grounds to Gandhi's study and sleeping quarters, feels sacred and grounded in history. Handwritten notes, rare photographs, and even traditional spinning wheels offer a quiet glimpse into the soul of the Mahatma.

The peaceful ambiance, chirping birds, and even the sight of graceful peacocks wandering in the lawns add to the spiritual feel of the place. It was deeply moving to walk through the places where Bapu meditated, wrote letters, spun khadi, and led a movement that changed the destiny of a nation.

Spending around four hours immersed in Gandhi's world was an enriching experience. For anyone visiting Ahmedabad, Sabarmati Ashram is a must-visit-not just to admire history but to reflect on simplicity, truth, and inner strength.

Wonderful place, preserved in its original form. Greenery in the campus comes as a relief, from concrete jungle and buildings surrounding ashram. Car park and entry is free and no fees or tickets are imposed. Library, photo gallery, life size statues make museum remarkable. Visiting Ashram is a gentle reminder of how much as a nation we failed Bapu, especially with cleanliness related issues in the country.

We loved learning more about the Mahatma. The museum has a lot of signage, but very informative if you take a few minutes to read each sign. The Gandhi quotes never cease to inspire. There is a nice garden there and a short walk to the riverfront. We were met by adorable and inquisitive schoolchildren, eager to practice their English.

places.address: Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Ashram Rd, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380027, India

places.generalDescription: Sabarmati Riverfront in Ahmedabad is a must-visit destination, offering a variety of attractions and activities. The iconic Sabarmati Ashram, located on the river's shores, is a significant historical site where Mahatma Gandhi spent several years. It now serves as a museum showcasing objects related to India's fight for independence. The riverfront promenade features parks, boating facilities, zip-line amusements, and markets.

sources.snippet: Sabarmati Riverfront is not only the best place for joggers and cyclers but indeed a fantastic place to have a pre-wedding photoshoot. A mere walk holding hands would suffice, but Riverfront has a lot of photo opportunities to offer. Apart from the fancy promenade providing enticing views of the Sabarmati River and the bridges of Ahmedabad in the backdrop, several festivals are held at the riverfront around the year.
sources.shortName: Discover Enchanting Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: The waterfront along the Sabarmati River is the ideal location for pre-wedding photos in Ahmedabad. The magnificent Sabarmati Riverfront urban development project has converted the river's banks into a vibrant and scenic public area. This colourful, well-kept garden offers many different species of plants and flowers.
sources.shortName: Top Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: Sabarmati Riverfront is a waterfront being developed to turn the area into a valuable urban asset. It hosts several events like Sabarmati Marathon, Flower Show, International Kite Festival, and airshows.

places.name: Sabarmati Riverfront, Nehru Bridge

reviews.text:
Narmada river front is an absolute beauty. It seems like we are in a European country.
Best time is to visit in evening or after sunset and take a stroll here.
They are provide rented bicycle, scooter and even stakes to enjoy with friends and family.
Amazing place and a must visit for everyone coming to visit Ahmedabad.

I went to Sabarmati Riverfront early in the morning during my exam days, and it turned out to be a very relaxing experience. The place is calm, the sound of the river waves is very soothing, and the cool morning breeze makes it even better.

Ahmedabad can be quite hot, so visiting this place in the morning felt really peaceful. There's a metro station around 2 km away, so it's also easy to reach. The main riverfront area is open 24/7, but if you want to visit the Atal Bridge or garden area, they open after 9 AM.

There are trees all around, and you can even find bicycles nearby to ride, though they are a bit costly. Still, it's a good experience, especially for visitors from outside the city.
Overall, a great spot for a quiet walk or just to sit and relax in the fresh air.

Very very Good place for a Cycling, Boating and also the cruise is available,
The Rickshaw and Buses and heavy vehicles are not allowed here riverfront is amazing place for peace.

places.address: 2HHF+H33, Sabarmati Riverfront Walkway E, Vishalpur, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380001, India

places.generalDescription: Kankaria Lake, a manmade marvel dating back to the 15th century, offers an array of attractions and activities for visitors. From boating and tethered balloon rides to a zoo, children's park, amusement park, and natural history museum along its shores, there's no shortage of entertainment. The lake also features an artificial island called Nagina Wadi accessible via a walkway.

sources.snippet: Kankaria Lake is the second largest lake in the whole city and it is among the top 3 venues for the best pre-wedding photography in Ahmedabad. Many of the photo sessions are being done here, mainly pre-wedding photography because mainly the couples are being attracted to this spot frequently. The lakefront was being renovated around this lake in the year 2008 and the lakefront is having its main public attractions I.e, zoo, toy train, kids city, tethered balloon ride, water rides, water park, food stalls, and many other entertainment facilities.
sources.shortName: Pre-Wedding Photography In Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: The largest waterbody in the city, Kankaria Lake has enticed the people of Ahmedabad and tourists flocking the city for many years now. Built in the fifteenth century by Sultans Muhammad Shah and Ahmed Shah II, it even had an in-built water purification system since it was the bathing place of most rulers of that era. An entertainment zone has now been developed on the lakeside, which has a zoo, kids‚Äô city, toy trains, a water park with loads of rides, and food stalls.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: The largest lake in Ahmedabad, Kankaria Lake is a manmade lake built in the 15th century by the Muslim ruler Sultan Qutbuddin and served as a bathing place for the kings. The lake is spread in a circumference of 3 miles and is built in a 34-sided polygonal shape with steps that lead into the water. The best time to visit the lake would be during the Kankaria Carnival, which is a week-long cultural and social festival held during the last week of December.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: 5 km from city center 5 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Also famous for its Kankaria Carnival which is full of week-long fun and festivities held in the last week of December, it is an entertainment, fun and cultural hub.

places.generalDescription: Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, constructed in 1573, is a stunning example of Islamic architecture located in Ahmedabad. The mosque is famous for its intricate latticework, particularly the delicate tree designs carved into its stone windows. This architectural gem showcases the influence of the African diaspora in India and features a mesmerizing sixteen-foot Sidi Saiyyed Jaali with the Tree of Life motif.

sources.snippet: Ahmedabad's exquisite stone latticework of the Sidi Saiyyed Mosque is used for a pre-wedding location near Ahmedabad. A unique and romantic atmosphere is created by the fascinating dance of light and shadow created by the delicate and elegant jali (lattice) windows. Pre-wedding portraits in this medieval mosque's exquisite patterns and spiritual atmosphere exude elegance and cultural worth.
sources.shortName: Best 10 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad - VsnapU

sources.snippet: Build in 1572 AD, Sidi Saiyyed Mosque is one of the most marvelously designed mosques in India. It is built using a typical Muslim indo-sarsenic style and displays a marvelous collection of latticework windows. The mosque was built during the final years of the Gujarat Sultanate before the land was conquered by the Mughals.

sources.snippet: Sidi Saiyyed Mosque ‚Äì Among the Best Tourist Places in Ahmedabad. Standing right in the centre of the city, Sidi Saiyyed Mosque has an ethereal beauty that knows no bounds. ‡ÆÜ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Æø‡Æ≤‡Æ§‡Øç‡Æ§‡Æø‡Æ≤‡Øç ‡Æé‡Æ¥‡ØÅ‡Æ§‡ØÅ‡Æµ‡Æ§‡Æ±‡Øç‡Æï‡ØÅ ‡ÆÆ‡Æ©‡Øç‡Æ©‡Æø‡Æï‡Øç‡Æï‡Æµ‡ØÅ‡ÆÆ‡Øç   dt 22-03-25.

Do Not Travel to Gujarat from March to July, the heat is very very very High.

Visited this famous well known mosque. Ladies are not allowed inside the mosque.

Mosque is quiet small and compact, but highlights the beauty of the indo islamic architecture.

Built in the year 1572-73 by an Abyssinian (person from Ethiopia) called Sidi Saiyyed, who served under the then sultan. This mosque is well known for the wonderful intricate carvings in stone and their unique semi circular tracery windows, depicting the tree of life.

Paper cutouts were made of the carved screens from which two wooden replicas were made and these are now in museum in London and New york.

The driver was telling us that this mosque is still in use as the emblem of the Ahmedabad municipality.

The grave of sidi saiyyed is inside this mosque.

The mosque is in a congested area, hence parking is out of the question. Definitely worth a visit to admire the wonderful jalli work in the windows.

The Sidi Saiyyed Mosque, built by a prominent Habshi noble in 1572‚Äì73, is revered for its exquisite jali screens-especially the iconic Tree of Life motif-and is celebrated as one of the finest monuments of Indo-Islamic art in Ahmedabad. Its enduring legacy reflects both its architectural vibrancy and the cultural history of the city.

places.generalDescription: Adalaj Stepwell, also known as Adalaj ni Vav, is a historical stepwell located in the village of Adalaj near Ahmedabad city in Gujarat. Dating back to 1499, this architectural marvel was commissioned by Queen Rudabai in memory of her husband. The stepwell features intricate carvings on its walls and is a popular heritage site in Gujarat.

sources.snippet: Adalaj Stepwell or Adalaj Ni Vav is located in Adalaj village which is just 19 km away from Ahmedabad. This steepwell was built by the Vaghela dynasty and it served as a harbour in the olden days. Known for its intricate designs and architecture, Adalaj Stepwell is just perfect for couples who want an old and mysterious vibe to their pre-wedding shoot.

‡ÆÜ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Æø‡Æ≤‡Æ§‡Øç‡Æ§‡Æø‡Æ≤‡Øç ‡Æé‡Æ¥‡ØÅ‡Æ§‡ØÅ‡Æµ‡Æ§‡Æ±‡Øç‡Æï‡ØÅ ‡ÆÆ‡Æ©‡Øç‡Æ©‡Æø‡Æï‡Øç‡Æï‡Æµ‡ØÅ‡ÆÆ‡Øç.

Adalaj stepwell is also called Rudabhai Step well, named after the queen, in whose honor it was built. Felt so happy we could visit this place and admire the beauty of it.

Stepwells are basically wells for washing, drinking and bathing purely for the ladies and it is very common in Gujarat and rajasthan area. The earliest step wells date back to 2nd century AD.

Over time, these step wells became an architectural marvel and wonderful place to show case their talent, their intricate carvings, their stunning symmetry. It is a wonderful place not only  for history lovers but for photographers too.

The Rudabhai step well is a five storied step well, built in 1498 by the then king Rana veer singh but completed in record time by Mohammed Begda the muslim ruler who killed Rana veer singh in battle.

Legend says, the queen Rudabhai tricked mohammed begda to finish the step well in record time on the condition that she will marry him, but when the step well was completed, she went back on her promise and killed her self in this step well.

You can also see some tombs on the step well and the legend goes that the mohammed begda killed the people who constructed such a fantastic step well in record time.

Definitely a must visit place if you are visiting Gujarat and in particular Ahmedabad. The place is more beautiful when you see it with your own eyes than in the photographs that you see on the net.

I like places that have historical significance, it shows where we are heading as a society. Everything around here is well maintained from the lush green parks to the maintenance of the stepwell. The smell of bats is one issue but again that's what makes this place authentic.

places.generalDescription: Sarkhej Roza is a captivating mosque and tomb complex that beautifully showcases the Indo-Saracenic architectural style, completed in 1451. Nestled amidst a serene landscape featuring a tranquil lake, this historical site reflects the rich Islamic culture intertwined with Persian influences and elements from Hindu and Jain traditions. Often hailed as the Acropolis of Ahmedabad, Sarkhej Roza stands as a testament to the city's heritage during Sultan Mahmud Begada's reign.

sources.snippet: An elegant architectural complex located in the village of Makarba, about 7 km from the city, Sarkhej Roza houses the final resting place of Sufi saint Hazrat Shaikh Ahmed Khattu, revered as the patron saint of Ahmedabad. Ahmed Shah ordered the construction of the complex after his death in 1445. Spread over 72 acres, the complex is built around a great stepped tank, which is surrounded by a 120-pillared mosque, a tomb to the saint, and pavilions.Birwa Qureshi, Artist and Founder of Crraft of Art, says this complex ‚Äúseamlessly integrates majestic buildings and lakes to create a breathtaking backdrop, transporting visitors to a bygone era‚Äù.Timings: 9am-6pm; Tickets: free
sources.shortName: 22 places to visit in Ahmedabad that are not tourist traps

sources.snippet: 8 km from city center 39 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Situated in the village of Makarba, 7 kms from Ahmedabad, Sarkhej Roza is a mosque and tomb complex. Bosting of absolutely striking early Islamic architectural finesse with spacious corridors and pillared domes, and surrounded by a mesmerising water tank, the tomb houses the grave of Ahmad Khattu Ganj Baksh (the former resident of the place).
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: A group of tombs and pillars make up the beautiful complex of Sarkhej Roza. Like most monuments in the city featuring Islamic architecture, this one too has some gorgeous latticework along with intricate carvings. Built around an artificial water body, called Sarkhej Lake, this tomb is among the architectural attractions of the city.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: With distinct influences from Persian, Hindu, Jain and Mughal architecture, Sarkhej Roza features an ancient tomb and a mosque that is most famous for its design and architectural elegance. This is definitely, a place to consider if you have artistic pursuits and a wardrobe to match.
sources.shortName: 15 awesome pre-wedding shoot locations in Gujarat

sources.snippet: At a short distance from Vishala Complex is Sarkhej Roza, which is a beautiful complex of tombs and pavilions. The complex is built around an artificial lake made for the rulers of Gujarat. The prominent tombs here include that of Ahmed Shah‚Äôs spiritual advisor, Sheikh Ahmed Khattu.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: Sarkhej Roza is a representation of religious harmony and cultural fusion. It is a combination of Hindu and Islamic styles. With its breathtaking architecture, calm ambience, and extensive historical backdrop, it is a great place for Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad.
sources.shortName: Top Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: Yet another masterpiece best suited for pre-wedding photoshoots in Ahmedabad. The architecture of Sarkhej Roza is an amalgamation of Hindu, Jain and Islamic styles. With a stupendous lake in the background, photoshoot at Sarkhej Roza will be surreal.
sources.shortName: Discover Enchanting Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Sarkhej Roza is an enchanting blend of Hindu, Jain and Islamic architecture. It is situated in a village that is only 7 kilometres from Ahmedabad. The historical beauty of this monument will take your pre-wedding pictures to the next level.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Ahmedabad!

sources.snippet: It is one of the finest places for a pre-wedding shoot location in Ahmedabad. This place can bring an art in the photographs. Sarkhej Roza is famous and apt as a photogenic place because of its architecture.
sources.shortName: Pre-Wedding Photography In Ahmedabad

places.name: Sarkhej Roza

reviews.text: It as a peaceful and serene place, appreciating the intricate details, exquisite craftsmanship, and tranquil surroundings. The site is also noted for its historical significance and the artistry displayed in the latticework and calligraphy.

‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ - A Magnificent Historical Complex with Some Practical Considerations

Sarkhej Roza is truly a hidden gem of Ahmedabad with its breathtaking architecture. The complex houses beautiful tombs of kings and queens, showcasing amazing historical significance. I was particularly impressed by the grand and picturesque lake that enhances the serene atmosphere of this ancient site.

The architecture is fascinating with its unique stylistic elements. The open courtyard provides a wonderful space to appreciate the intricate details of the structure and offers great photo opportunities. The exquisite lattice work and carved pillars throughout the complex are truly mesmerizing, especially when sunlight filters through.

Important note: You must remove your footwear before entering the complex, which can be uncomfortable as the ground gets very hot and dirty. I strongly recommend wearing socks as mentioned in the guidelines. Also, avoid visiting during rainy days as the experience will be compromised, and extremely hot days can make the visit unbearable since you'll be walking barefoot on hot surfaces.

Despite these minor inconveniences, Sarkhej Roza is definitely worth visiting for its historical significance and architectural beauty if you plan your visit during comfortable weather conditions.

Sarkhej Roza is a historically significant tomb complex with stunning Indo-Islamic architecture, but it's sadly not well maintained.

The entrance lacks the presence of a protected heritage site, and the overall upkeep doesn't do justice to its legacy. It deserves better maintenance and stronger promotion to attract the attention it truly merits.

places.address: Post Jeevraj Park, Sarkhej Makarba Rd, Makarba, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380051, India

places.generalDescription: Kamla Nehru Zoological Garden, also known as Kankaria Zoo, is a wildlife park located in Ahmedabad. Established in 1951, it spans across 117 acres and is home to over 450 animals, 2000 birds, and 140 reptiles. The zoo features albino animals and endangered bird species. Visitors can also enjoy attractions like an amusement park, children's park, toy train, and balloon safari within the premises.

sources.snippet: 5 km from city center 20 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Popularly known as Kankaria Zoo, Kamala Nehru Zoo is located at Kankaria, Ahmedabad. By the majestic banks of the tranquil Kankaria Lake, this zoo has been the abode of different animals, reptiles, birds and mammals belonging to different species.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Kamla Nehru Zoological Garden

reviews.text:
I had a great time visiting Kankaria Zoo in Ahmedabad! The zoo is well-maintained, with a good variety of animals, including lions, tigers, leopards, and many exotic birds. The enclosures are spacious, and the zoo is clean and organized, making it a great place for families and kids. The location near Kankaria Lake adds to the overall experience.

However, I noticed that many visitors were not following zoo protocols-some were disturbing animals and throwing garbage around. The zoo staff needs to be stricter in enforcing rules to ensure a better environment for both animals and visitors. Despite this, it's still a great place to explore and learn about wildlife!
The kamla nehru zoological garden it's mind blowing zoo I really like this zoo here Lion tiger leopard elephant jackal deer sea horse different species of birds etc are all found here. It is very fun to come here with family as there are many activities for small children too. Tickets are only ‚Çπ50 and entry gate is 3 Kankaria lake is also located next to the zoo and a mini train is also found there.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (4/5)
I had a great time visiting Kankaria Zoo in Ahmedabad! The zoo is well-maintained, with a good variety of animals, including lions, tigers, leopards, and many exotic birds. The enclosures are spacious, and the zoo is clean and organized, making it a great place for families and kids. The location near Kankaria Lake adds to the overall experience.

However, I noticed that many visitors were not following zoo protocols-some were disturbing animals and throwing garbage around. The zoo staff needs to be stricter in enforcing rules to ensure a better environment for both animals and visitors. Despite this, it's still a great place to explore and learn about wildlife!

The zoo is spacious, clean, and well-organized with a good variety of animals and birds. From majestic lions and tigers to colorful parrots and playful monkeys, there's so much to see. The enclosures are well-maintained, and most animals appear healthy and active.

It's a great place for kids to learn about wildlife, and the information boards near each enclosure are helpful. The environment feels safe, and ticket prices are very reasonable. The zoo is also part of the larger Kankaria Lake complex, so you can enjoy multiple activities in one visit.

A perfect spot for a fun and educational day out! Highly recommended when visiting Kankaria.

places.address: 2J53+F9X, near butterfly park, Kankaria, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380008, India

places.generalDescription: Parimal Garden in Ahmedabad is a romantic oasis, offering a serene escape within the city. The garden boasts vibrant flowers, lush greenery, and various romantic spots like blooming trees and peaceful corners overlooking a pond. It's also a popular picnic spot with shady areas, benches, a children's playground, and a majestic pond with a fountain. The well-maintained garden is home to diverse bird species and provides facilities such as clean washrooms and free drinking water.

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 37 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Located on the Parimal Cross Road in Ambavadi, Parimal Garden is a beautiful well-maintained garden in the heart of Ahmedabad. Replete with swings and dotted with stone benches, the park is popular among both adults and kids alike.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Parimal Garden

reviews.text:
This place is very soothing and peaceful. The chirping of birds and the drizzle of water from fountain is so soothing that you can sit their ideally for hours and not even get bore of it.

I was so much relieved after I visited there. It is a place to heal your soul! üòçüòçüòç

Strictly and totally recommended! ‚úÖ‚úÖ‚úÖ

A beautiful garden-perfect for relaxing in the evening. If you're planning to visit Ahmedabad, avoid the off-season. Also, try not to visit this garden during the daytime, as the temperatures can get extremely high. Evenings are the best time to enjoy it.

Went here for a short walk. The garden is well maintained and very pretty. It also has 2 water bodies and a lot of space to sit. I think there are 3-4 entries to the Garden. It is home to many birds, cats, dogs and turtles.

There was a gymnasium also (dont know if its paid or unpaid).
There is a free pet training park also inside the garden.

At late night the lights there look very pretty. Beware of couples making out tho ‚ò†Ô∏èüòµ‚Äçüí´üòÇ

places.address: Chimanlal Girdharlal Rd, Panchavati Society, Ambawadi, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380006, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Ahmedabad, Gotila Garden-Talav is a sprawling 52,000 square meter oasis that offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. This beautifully landscaped park features lush greenery, vibrant flowers, and shady trees that create a tranquil atmosphere perfect for families looking to unwind.

sources.snippet: 7 km from city center 50 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Gotila Garden-Talav is a vibrant green garden situated in Sindhubhavan Road, Thaltej in Ahmedabad. Blessed with vibrant flowers, beautifyl water sprinklers, quaint benches and shady trees, the garden is a haven for city dwellers as well as birds.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Gotila Garden-Talav

reviews.text: This garden is redeveloped and inaugurated recently. The atmosphere is mind refreshing. It was very bigger than my expectations. Good to be there to spend quality time with near ones. There are multiple walking-jogging tracks, children play area and jungle gym instruments. There is a small pond which was empty when I visited. Don't get surprised if you find collegian friends or young couples in awkward conditions. The garden is maintained very well. It is highly recommended to all.

Beautiful garden to visit !
It is a decent place for morning/evening walks,for chilling with friends,to just sit and relax,for clicking some good photographs
This place has a good unpaved path which is long enough
There are also mini free library boxes for the keen readers to take books
Trashbins are placed covering most of the place
The entry fees is 10rs
There are many benches to sit and relax too
Some art works of statues are also placed here
Should consider this place to go

Best park in ahmedabad,  Good for morning  walking,  exercise,  nigh out with friends and family. Best place for family picnic.
Play ground is  with soft base so safe for kids. Walking area are well maintained even you can walk on monsoon season.

places.generalDescription: Bai Harir Vav in Ahmedabad is an ancient underground stepwell dating back to the 15th century. It is named after Dhai Harir, the superintendent of Sultan Mahmud Begada's harem. The stepwell features elaborate carvings, cascading steps, and cool waters. Visitors can admire the intricate motifs and ornate columns as they descend into its depths.

sources.snippet: Dada Harir Vav is yet another brilliantly built stepwell in Ahmedabad. With all of its intricate details, this five-storied well is full of charm. While you are here, you will be transported back to the old days.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Ahmedabad!

sources.snippet: Another stepwell in Ahmedabad is the Dada Harir Stepwell, built in 1485 by Dhai Harir, a  household lady of Mahmud Begada. Dhai Harir also built a  mosque and tomb, where she was buried.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad ‚Äì UI/UX DESIGNER

places.name: Bai Harir Vav Ahmedabad

reviews.text: Beautiful and historic stepwell with impressive architecture. The intricate carvings showcase amazing craftsmanship. It's a peaceful spot perfect for history lovers.Could use better maintenance in some areas, and the signage is limited, making it a bit confusing to navigate. Facilities like restrooms are minimal.

This ancient wonder was probably built to access underground water table is an understatement. It is no mean achievement to go five to six stories underground and build something like an ornate mall-like structure in an era absolutely devoid of heavy machinery, earth movers and electricity. A treat to the eyes stands here built just purely relying on human ingenuity and hard labour. It truly is one of the architectural wonders and marvels. It is nice to see it's well preserved and also maintained despite the dense population surrounding it. It would be nice if the water in the well is used regularly so that it doesn't become stagnant and murky.

Lovely place in the bustling city of Ahmedabad! It's a place not known by many. And probably that's good because there is little crowd there. But wait, it is crowded by lot of llangurs. Probably the most I have seen at any place. The architecture is beautiful and it has 5 storey to it. We could only go till the 3rd storey beneath the ground.

places.address: Hanumansingh Rd, Haripura, Asarwa, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380016, India

places.generalDescription: Thol Bird Sanctuary is a serene freshwater reservoir and man-made lake that provides a habitat for various bird species, including flamingoes and sarus cranes. Located near the village of Thol in Gujarat's Mehsana district, this nearly century-old sanctuary offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The best time to visit is during the monsoon season when the sanctuary teems with vibrant avian life.

sources.snippet: Another such place which is great for the photography in Ahmedabad is the Thol Bird Sanctuary. No matter which day you go there, you can always find a bunch of people roaming. Along with that, there are a lot of varieties of birds who can give a unique touch to your photography.
sources.shortName: Best places in Ahmedabad for street photography

places.name: Thol Bird Sanctuary

reviews.text:
Visiting the bird sanctuary was a wonderful experience. We went early in the morning, and the fresh air, peaceful surroundings, and sounds of birds made it feel very refreshing. The whole place looked beautiful in the morning light, and walking around felt very calming.

Going with a friend made it even better. We enjoyed spotting different birds together, taking photos, and just relaxing while watching nature. It felt like a perfect start to the day - peaceful, joyful, and full of life. I would definitely love to visit again, especially in the morning with friends!

Recently visited Thol Bird Sanctuary, and it was an absolutely beautiful experience! The sight of the vast Thol Lake with the rising sun was mesmerizing. The calm waters, the golden hues of sunrise, and the symphony of birds created a truly heartwarming scene. I spotted so many different bird species, and their chirping added to the serenity of the place. A perfect spot for nature lovers, bird watchers, and photography enthusiasts. Highly recommended for a peaceful escape into nature!

Peaceful bird sanctuary with limited crowd. Best time to visit is during sunrise. U can hear birds chirping and gettimg ready for the day. Carry cash for the entry fee which is 50 rupees per person. Having binoculars with you will help u watch the birds closely.

places.address: 49RV+344, Thol Bird Sanctuary Rd, Thol Rd, Gujarat 382165, India

places.generalDescription: Auto World Vintage Car Museum, located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, is a captivating outdoor showcase of vintage automobiles, including cars, carriages, motorcycles and carts from renowned manufacturers. The museum boasts an impressive collection of classic vehicles such as the 1923 Rolls 20 HP and Chrysler Imperial Airflow, Bentley Mark VI. Founded by Shri Pranlal Bhogilal Patel in 1927, this museum houses over 100 exclusive vintage cars and offers a fascinating experience for motor enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Nestled in Dastaan, a 2,200-acre estate, is one of India‚Äôs biggest personal collections of vintage cars, bikes, buggies, and utility vehicles, belonging to collector Pranlal Bhogilal, who amassed almost 200 cars and founded the Vintage and Classic Car Club of India.Timings: 8am-9pm; Tickets: Rs50
sources.shortName: 22 places to visit in Ahmedabad that are not tourist traps

sources.snippet: Auto World Vintage Car Museum has a marvellous collection of vintage cars, carts and motorcycles. You will see all sorts of vintage automobile beauties here from Maybachs to Bentleys. Motor enthusiasts are going to have a fun time having their pre-wedding photoshoot at this location as you not only get to have cool pictures here but also learn a lot about the motor world.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Ahmedabad!

sources.snippet: Auto World Vintage Car Museum ‚Äì Among the Best Tourist Places in Ahmedabad. The history and the evolutionary journey of automobiles can be witnessed at this museum. Right from horse-drawn carriages and railway saloons to spectacular convertibles, some grand vintage cars, and a gorgeous collection of vintage buggies, the museum is a visual delight for tourists.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: 12 km from city center 9 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. A connoisseur of vintage cars converted his private collection of vintage cars into a museum. The collection comprises of the best of the world - Rolls Royce, Bentley, Jaguar, Cadillac, Austin and many more.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Auto World Vintage Car Museum will fulfil your dream right here in Ahmedabad. Photoshoots in the vintage car will be one-of-its-kind and not just another cliched couple photoshoot. The collection at the museum ranges from Rolls-Royce to Bentleys to Maybach and so on.
sources.shortName: Discover Enchanting Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Ahmedabad

places.name: Auto World Vintage Car Museum

reviews.text: Nicely maintained museum. A must visit for vintage car enthusiasts. The cars were nicely maintained. There are also a few carriage and  bikes. The staff is also good. Entry fees are Rs. 100 for above 11 years of age and Rs. 50 for 11 and below. Rs. 100 are charges for photography using 1 camera/mobile. Videography costs more. The atmosphere around is very calm with peacocks and peahen playing around.

If you are in Ahmedabad this is a must visit place. There are around 122 cars and some horse carts that shows the evolution of transportation and also the style of cars. I was fascinated by how each one of them are maintained in spic and span conditions.
It easily takes 90 minutes to go through every car and observe the detailing. If you are an automobile design enthusiast you will cherish all the moments spent here. The venue is in private property which houses residence of the owner. The residence landscape is nicely maintained which adds to the charm. There is also a restaurant inside which I didn't try.
I have deducted one star for the rude behaviour of the staff.  They seem to be guiding as if we are going to ruin the displays. I understand that many would be doing that but they get to understand customer experience especially when they are charging Rs 100 entry ticket. And additional Rs. 100 for every photography device.

Auto World Car Museum is a hidden gem for automobile lovers! The collection is truly impressive ‚Äì from vintage classics to luxury models, each car is beautifully maintained and displayed. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, sharing interesting stories behind the cars. The layout is well-organized, making it easy to walk through and enjoy at your own pace. It's a must-visit if you're into cars or history. I was pleasantly surprised by the variety and rare models showcased. Highly recommended for families, tourists, and car enthusiasts!

There is entry prize around 100 rupees for clicking photographs. And there is a caf√© inside

places.address: Dastan Estate, Service Rd, Nikol, Kathwada, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 382430, India

places.generalDescription: Jhulta Minar, also known as the Shaking Minarets, is a fascinating architectural wonder located in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. Situated within the Sidi Bashir Mosque complex, these minarets are renowned for their unique shaking phenomenon. When one minaret is shaken, the other starts shaking on its own despite being connected by intricate arches and corridors. This perplexing optical illusion has puzzled visitors for centuries and remains an unsolved mystery to this day.

sources.snippet: Jhulta Minar, often called the Shaking Minarets, will tickle your scientific minds as even the gentlest shaking of one makes the other vibrate too within seconds. Once a part of Sidi Bashir Mosque, these wondrous minarets are now located north of Ahmedabad Junction. The architecture of these three-storied tall minarets with carved balconies is definitely worth admiring for history enthusiasts.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Jhulta Minar or the Shaking Minarets are one of the most intriguing pieces of architecture. It is said that when one of the minarets was shaken, the other one had vibrations too and no one could figure out the reason why. If you and your partner are into mysterious architecture, you are going to love having your pre-wedding shoot done at Jhulta Minar!
sources.shortName: 17 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Ahmedabad!

sources.snippet: Ahmedabad's Jhulta Minar is a magnificent example of architecture. It is one of the elements of the Sidi Bashir Mosque complex, which also includes Jhulta Minar or Shaking Minarets. It is special because, in reaction to the first minaret's trembling, the far minaret starts to vibrate as well; it's as though a strange force connects them.
sources.shortName: Top Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: The story of Jhulta Minara- Shaking Minarets is very interesting and mysterious. It is said that if one minara is shaken the other one begins to vibrate on its own and nobody till date has been able to decode the engineering of the minarets. Its architecture is quite mysterious and complicated.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Places to Visit in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: 4 km from city center 22 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Located in Ahmedabad, Jhuta Minar is one of the most intriguing architectural wonders that the world has ever seen. They are still an unsolvable mystery.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Jhulta Minar, Bibiji Masjid

reviews.text: A true architectural wonder! Jhulta Minara Masjid, also known as the Shaking Minarets, is a fascinating historical site in Ahmedabad. The unique feature of the minarets-where one shakes and the other vibrates-is an incredible mystery of ancient engineering. The intricate carvings and Mughal-era architecture add to its beauty. Though access to the minarets is restricted, the mosque itself is a peaceful and well-maintained place. A must-visit for history and architecture enthusiasts!

Amazing piece of historic architecture! The shaking minarets are truly fascinating. A must-see for anyone interested in ancient engineering and mystery. Interesting concept but poorly maintained. You can't experience the shaking anymore due to restricted access. Needs better care and signage.

Historical place. Bibi masjid known as Jhoolta minara (shaking Minar) masjid built by king sultan of Gujarat in 1455. Beutiful masjid having unique facility to pray ladies in the masjid. There is a mesenin floored area with separate entry gate for ladies prayer area. This type unique facility is in 5 to 6 Masjids of Ahmedabad. All these masjids were built by the same  family kings of Gujarat.

places.address: 5, Julta Minar Rd, Manhar Nagar Society, Rajpur Hirpur, Gomtipur, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380038, India

places.generalDescription: Indroda Park, located near Gandhinagar in India, is a lush and exotic destination that offers a variety of attractions for nature enthusiasts. The park boasts healthy flora and fauna, including cute animals, birds, and insects. Visitors can explore the zoo, amphitheater, and event centers for academic research. The park's dinosaur museum is particularly popular due to its vast collection of fossilized dinosaur eggs, bones, and footprints.

sources.snippet: Indroda Park is situated in Gandhinagar which is a few kilometres away from Ahmedabad but it is definitely worth the travel because of the exotic green views that you get here. The Indroda Park is lush with healthy flora and fauna. So, along with some ethereal trees, plants and grasses, you will also be greeted by cute animals, birds and insects here.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations In Ahmedabad!

sources.snippet: A little away from Ahmedabad, Indroda Park is located in Gandhinagar. Spread over 400 hectares on the banks of river Sabarmati. Get yourselves clicked in front of the humungous Dinasour structure at Indroda Park, something that no one would have ever thought of.
sources.shortName: Discover Enchanting Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Ahmedabad

places.name: Indroda Nature Park

reviews.text:
Indroda Nature Park is a perfect spot for a one-day outing with family and kids. The park is clean, green, and well-maintained. The Dinosaur Park is the main highlight with life-size models and fossil exhibits ‚Äì very educational and fun for children. The zoo section has a decent variety of animals like deer, crocodiles, birds, and reptiles. There's also a peaceful botanical garden and shaded picnic areas.

The walking trails and riverside views are relaxing, and the atmosphere is close to nature. It's both informative and enjoyable. Do carry your own food and water, as food options are limited. Overall, a great place to spend 3‚Äì5 hours amidst nature.

Visited this weekend after like 7-8 years. Everything remains the same, A few animals are either too old or already deceased (Hereby, an empty cage). It is still a perfect day out i would say. Also, the Dinosaur park is great too for anyone interested. Good parking space, On spot tickets worth Rs..30/person and parking is Rs.30 too. A different world altogether once you enter the main gate.

Indroda Nature Park is a wonderful place for a day out with family and kids!

The park has a great variety of animals and plenty to explore.

We saw lots of peacocks roaming freely, which was a real treat.

There's good parking available and drinking water facilities throughout the park, making the visit comfortable.

It's spacious, well-maintained, and perfect for nature lovers.

Highly recommended for a fun and educational experience!

places.generalDescription: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Memorial, located in Shahibaug, Ahmedabad, is a museum and exhibition center dedicated to India's first Deputy PM. Housed in the historic Moti Shahi Mahal, the museum showcases documents, journals, portraits, and personal belongings of Sardar Patel. The Mughal architecture of the building adds to its allure. Visitors can also enjoy 3D light, sound, and laser shows that narrate India's history.

sources.snippet: The Moti Shahi Mahal, a palace built by Mughal emperor Shahjahan between 1618 and 1622, is now the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Memorial, showcasing a museum and exhibition centre that offer a deeper look at Patel‚Äôs life. The white and red building has a central hall with portraits of Patel, his family, and friends, and also displays his work during the Indian freedom struggle with descriptions and quotes. The 3D sound, light, and laser show takes one through India‚Äôs journey towards independence.Timings: 9:30am-5pm (Monday closed); Tickets: Rs20
sources.shortName: 22 places to visit in Ahmedabad that are not tourist traps

sources.snippet: 4 km from city center 21 out of 64 Places To Visit in Ahmedabad. Situated in the premises of Moti Shahi Mahal at Shahibaug in Ahmedabad, Sardar Vallabhai Patel National Museum is a museum and a memorial dedicated to the 1st Deputy Prime Minister of India - Sardar Vallabhai Patel. The museum has exhibitions in English, Hindi and Gujarati.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Ahmedabad | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel National Memorial

reviews.text: sardar Vallabhbhai Patel national memorial situated near circuit house at shahi bagh. The Museum is really awesome will get to know about the iron man of India and his journey to get india freedom, there is also a auditorium where they will play a short video about his journey, Must visit if you are going to Ahmedabad and the ticket would just cost you Rs 30.Worth a visit. I came here for the job fair on 29th November 2024.

Located on the Bank of Sabarmati River.
Very Nice & Spacious Place.
Had attended a Function of Parichay Sammelan of Khadayata caste on 5/1/2025.
Open Parking Space.
AC Hall was Nicely decorated.
Open Lawn Space was well maintained.
Toilets were not Clean.

It's an Amazing place, i visited there for some reason.. and i was really shocked to see such a beautiful place, it was clean and had too much Green all over.. really very nice and tidy place. thanks to all those who give their 100% for cleanliness..

places.address: Gandhi-Sardar Smruthi Chowk, opp. Circuit House, Bhimnath Mahadev, Shahibag, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380004, India

places.generalDescription: Amdavad Ni Gufa is a renowned art gallery in the city, known for its contemporary and cavernous design. The space was designed by the celebrated architect Balkrishna V Doshi and features artwork by legendary Indian artist Maqbool Fida Husain. The gallery's unique cave-like structure makes it stand out among modern architecture in India, with interconnected domes supported by tree-like pillars.

sources.snippet: Master architect BV Doshi‚Äôs friendship with artist MF Husain resulted in Amdavad ni Gufa, an unusual art gallery located on the CEPT Campus in Ahmedabad. The cave-like underground structure comprises multiple interconnected domes, covered with a mosaic of tiles. The inside has irregular tree-like columns, and showcases Husain‚Äôs bold artwork, including his famous horses on the walls.
sources.shortName: 22 places to visit in Ahmedabad that are not tourist traps

places.name: Amdavad Ni Gufa

reviews.text: A unique underground art gallery with a very creative and peaceful vibe. The architecture is unlike anything else dome-shaped, cave-like, and beautifully lit. Showcases modern art in a truly unusual setting. Worth a visit if you're into art, design, or just something different in the city.

The cave is unique! Once you go in you'll understand what the murals and the structures are trying to convey. Well made! There's a nice cafe where like-minded people sit and discuss art. A gallery is there as well with fee entry

The Amdavad ni Gufa was built during my final years at CEPT, a time when it captured the imagination of every student. Its cave-like form was mesmerizing, not just for its concept but also for its unconventional construction techniques, particularly the use of ferrocement.

Colleagues who had worked at B.V. Doshi's office shared fascinating insights-Doshi, the visionary Pritzker Prize-winning architect, would often sketch directly on-site, and the team would build from those sketches. The steps leading to the Gufa's entrance, they say, were first marked directly on the ground, constructed, and only then documented into drawings.

The shimmering china mosaic domes were a source of fascination for students. It was commonly referred to as the "Doshi-Hussain Gufa," though originally named "Hussain-Doshi Gufa" before it was dedicated to the people of Ahmedabad and rechristened "Amdavad ni Gufa."

At the back, a door and pathway evoke images of Indus Valley Civilization structures unearthed at Lothal and Mohenjodaro, with a ramp descending into the earth. The intricate designs on the door grills add to its enigmatic charm.

A building with no defined purpose-simply a place to sit, read, and reflect. M.F. Hussain had painted spontaneous, sketch-like figures on the interior domes, though nothing substantial. Some of his cutout drawings remain, adding to the ambiance. Children are particularly enthralled by the mysterious structure. For years, they were allowed to play atop the domes, but recently, this has been restricted to preserve the aging china mosaic.

A marvel of architecture, the Gufa stands strong-though perhaps in the near future, it may require thoughtful restoration to preserve its legacy.

places.address: 2GPX+GW6, Kasturbhai Lalbhai Campus Opp Gujarat University campus, CEPT campus, Navrangpura, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380009, India

places.generalDescription: Thol is a serene lake surrounded by marshland and is home to the Thol Wildlife Sanctuary, where visitors can spot pelicans and flamingos. The sanctuary, located less than an hour from Ahmedabad, offers a great opportunity for bird-watching with over 150 types of birds to be seen. It's also recommended to combine a visit to the Nalsarovar Bird Sanctuary, which is home to more than 250 species of migratory birds.

sources.snippet: This is a magnificent place in Ahmedabad for a pre-wedding photography. Thol is mainly famous for its lake and the amazing backdrop which it provides, is definitely combined with an amazing photo/video session. Mainly pre-wed couples are likely to visit this place for a photo shoot because of the spot‚Äôs natural beauty which caters to a romantic photo shoot.
sources.shortName: Pre-Wedding Photography In Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Thol Bird Sanctuary, located on the outskirts of Ahmedabad, is a hidden treasure for people who appreciate the natural world. This is a photographer's and birdwatcher's paradise because of the variety of migrating species that may be photographed here. The lake is the ideal location for photographing romantic moments because it is encircled by thick nature.
sources.shortName: Top Pre-Wedding Shoot Locations in Ahmedabad, Gujarat

sources.snippet: It is not just nature‚Äôs and bird‚Äôs paradise, but a paradise for photographers too. Thol Bird Sanctuary is greeted by a myriad species of birds around the year. For couples seeking a peaceful and picturesque background for their pre-wedding shoot, Thol Lake is your best bet.
sources.shortName: Discover Enchanting Pre-Wedding Photoshoot Locations in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Thol Lake is an artificial freshwater lake near Thol village. It was constructed as an irrigation tank in 1912. It is home to about 150 species of both native and migratory birds like flamingos, pelicans, geese, ducks, lapwings, etc.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad ‚Äì UI/UX DESIGNER

sources.snippet: Pink flamingoes, a golden sunset and the breeze rippling the waters of the shallow reservoir that is Thol Lake; it‚Äôs a romantic, beautiful vibe that will translate not only visually but also put you in a wonderful mood.
sources.shortName: 15 awesome pre-wedding shoot locations in Gujarat
12 Picnic Spots in and Around Ahmedabad

places.name: Thol

reviews.text: The best place to visit in the early morning. One  can feel the nature and the beauty of being surrounded by nature. Its a calming place near the city. This place will bring you peace of mind in the middle of the chaotic city life. Bring food and a camera with you , you can have a picnic with friends or family, there is a parking fee and ticket , wear shoes and stroll for best views.

One should go early morning to watch sunrise and not to be bothered by the daytime heat. Birds are pretty cool in shape and colors. They also have binocular to watch birds. We camped with some wooden sticks there, made ourselves cup noddles and had tea. It was a really nice experience. It opens by 5-5:30am so should do early.
Beautiful place for sunrise and birdwatching. Go early to avoid the heat. Loved the peaceful vibe, cup noodles, and tea by the lake.

places.generalDescription: Rani no Hajiro, also known as Mughalai Bibis Tomb, is a historic tomb complex in Ahmedabad that dates back to the time of Ahmed Shah and other Gujarat Sultanate rulers. This elaborate structure is adorned with intricate mother-of-pearl and metal work and serves as the final resting place for the queens of the empire.

sources.snippet: Rani no Hajiro, which means Queen‚Äôs Tomb in Gujarati, holds the graves of the queen consorts of Ahmed Shah. Away from the chaos of the city, tourists flock this place for the calm that marks the place, in complete contrast to its appearance which has been made quite lively with buntings added to the place by the squatters. The graves here, unlike at other tombs, are not in a closed hall but in an open courtyard.
sources.shortName: 22 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad (2024) Tourist Places in Ahmedabad

sources.snippet: Located right opposite to Baadshah no Hajiro, we have the Rani no Hajiro, where female members of the royal family of Ahmed Shah I, were buried. Both men and women are allowed inside the tombs.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Ahmedabad ‚Äì UI/UX DESIGNER

places.name: Rani no Hajiro

reviews.text:
I recently visited Rani no Hajiro in Ahmedabad, which is a great place for shopping. You can find beautiful traditional clothes, jewellery, and accessories at very good prices.
After shopping, I went to Manekchowk, which is very famous for street food. I tried Mahalaxmi Bhajipav, sandwich, and the popular gotala dosa. everything was delicious! The place is full of energy at night and perfect for food lovers.

‚ÄúRani no Hajiro: A Hidden Gem in Ahmedabad‚Äù

Rani no Hajiro is a beautiful yet underrated historical site tucked away in the bustling Manek Chowk food area. It's a hidden gem surrounded by local residences and the lively old bazaar, offering a unique blend of history and everyday life.

What Makes It Special:
‚Ä¢	Intricate Architecture: The beautiful windows with intricate carvings and neglected yet charming structures give it a timeless aura. It's a treat for architecture enthusiasts and photographers.
‚Ä¢	Hidden Location: The site is well-hidden and not overly crowded, adding to its charm as a peaceful escape amidst the chaos of Manek Chowk.

Things to Note:
‚Ä¢	Neglect and Maintenance: Unfortunately, the structures are not well-maintained, and the surrounding area can feel a bit neglected.
‚Ä¢	Accessibility: You can't take your car here-it's best to park on the main road and explore the area on foot. Walking through the narrow lanes of the old bazaar is an experience in itself.
‚Ä¢	Ask for Directions: Don't rely solely on Google Maps. It's better to ask locals for directions, as the area can be tricky to navigate.

Tips:
‚Ä¢	Combine your visit with a stroll through the old bazaar and enjoy the food and vibe of Manek Chowk.
‚Ä¢	Be prepared for some walking, and take your time exploring this hidden slice of Ahmedabad's history.

If you're a lover of history and hidden treasures, Rani no Hajiro is worth the visit despite its challenges. It's a glimpse into the city's rich past amidst its thriving present!
Went for random photoshoot but you can buy oxidised jewellery and enjoy street food of Ahmedabad city... heritage buildings and pod culture.

places.address: Manek Chowk Rd, Old City, Mandvi ni Pol, Khadia, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380001, India
